bug.author: apc999
bug.summary: Brew install does not work out of box
bug.description:
Alluxio Version: 1.8.1 Describe the bug The installation of Alluxio of brew on MacOS does not work out of box. One needs to set alluxio.master.hostname in conf/alluxio-site.properties to make it work
MacOS: 10.14.3 brew version: Homebrew 2.0.3-28-gd8c6f6b
To Reproduce <denchmark-code>$ brew install alluxio $ cd /usr/local/Cellar/alluxio/1.8.1/libexec & bin/alluxio-start.sh local -f $ jps 11190 AlluxioMaster 11384 Jps 11192 AlluxioSecondaryMaster $ cat logs/worker.log 2019-03-08 21:54:08,029 ERROR AlluxioWorker - Fatal error: Cannot run alluxio worker; master hostname is not configured. Please modify alluxio-site.properties to either set alluxio.master.hostname or configure zookeeper with alluxio.zookeeper.enabled=true and alluxio.zookeeper.address=[comma-separated zookeeper master addresses] </denchmark-code>
Expected behavior For local brew install, we should pre-configure the alluxio.master.hostname to localhost Additional context N/A

comments.comment: This issue has been solved by <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew-core/pull/37813>Homebrew/homebrew-core#37813</denchmark-link> which has been merged. is now working out of box! thanks <denchmark-link:https://github.com/IT-DONG>@IT-DONG</denchmark-link> !
